column2: 0.1) Compile with your expertise level for each competence [Automotive]
column3: 0.1) Compile with your expertise level for each competence [Cybersecurity]
column4: 0.1) Compile with your expertise level for each competence [Hardware and Software Resilience]
column7: 1.1) In which scenario can a rogue Wi-Fi access point be utilized to compromise a vehicle's system?
column8: 1.2) What technique involves the modification of the ECU's software to run customized code permanently by bypassing update verification?
column9: 1.3) Which attack technique involves adversaries remotely accessing services on Tesla vehicles using predefined ports and hard-coded passwords?
column10: 1.4) In the context of automotive cybersecurity, which of the following describes the 'Local Function' technique?
column11: 1.5) Which attack vector could be used by adversaries aiming to modify an ECU firmware?
column12: 1.6) What is the role of official aftermarket/dealer equipment in accessing vehicle systems?
column13: 1.7) In what scenario can adversaries potentially avoid credential authentication entirely during an attack on a vehicle's ECU?
column14: 1.8) What is one potential outcome of the 'Abuse UDS for Affecting Vehicle Function' technique?
column15: 1.9) What role can play the modification of the OS partitions in vehicle cyber attacks?
column16: 1.10)  How can an adversarial user exploit a vulnerability in the Wi-Fi stack to gain command execution on a Tesla Model 3?
column17: 1.11) The operating system kernel vulnerability (CVE-2013-6282) allows adversaries to remotely access the vehicle's network without any privilege escalation.
column18: 1.12) A diagnostic function misuse allows the injection of CAN bus messages, which can result in unintended vehicle operations such as locking or unlocking the vehicle
column19: 1.13) SSH can be used for lateral movement from a compromised CID to the IC ECU, representing a technique of remote services exploitation
column20: 1.14) Discovering unsecured login credentials for an SSH service on a Tesla's CID indicates the use of relay communications
column21: 1.15) In a scenario where adversaries bypass a mandatory access control mechanism like AppArmor, they exploit a vulnerability in the vehicle's operating system to disable access control
column22: 1.16) When exploiting a browser for initial access, adversaries typically gain access by exploiting services designed to accept remote connections like SSH and VNC
column23: 1.17) An attacker can typically achieve persistence on a vehicle ECU by exploiting short range wireless communication protocols like Bluetooth and Wi-Fi
column24: 1.18) Bluetooth vulnerabilities are tipically used to perform system information discovery in a vehicle's internal compute systems
column25: 1.19) Researchers found that acquiring seeds/keys via brute force is not feasible on any ECUs on a vehicle's CAN
column26: 1.20) Exploiting insecurely stored credentials can allow attackers to gain access without needing to bypass code-signing mechanisms
column27: 1.21) Using electromagnetic fault injection, adversaries can manipulate communication networks to spoof GPS coordinates without requiring direct physical access to the vehicle
column28: 1.22) By placing a network interface into promiscuous mode, adversaries can passively access data in transit over the vehicle network, potentially capturing configuration details such as IP addresses, hostnames, and VLAN IDs
column29: 1.23) An adversary exploits a Bluetooth connection vulnerability to gain remote code execution in a vehicle by targeting its short-range wireless communication capabilities
column30: 1.24) An adversary gaining physical access to a vehicle's OBD-II port can directly access all ECUs connected to both low and high-speed CANs, allowing them to modify firmware and install other malicious software
column31: 1.25) By utilizing third-party OBD-II accessories, adversaries can gain initial access to a vehicle's network, potentially allowing them to exfiltrate data using paired devices
column32: Do you have any feedback on the quiz? Thanks.
